topic.title: Auditing
topic.shortdesc: Actions performed on Couchbase Server can be audited. This allows a full administrator to ensure that system-management tasks are being appropriately performed; and also facilitates compliance with regulatory standards.

section.title: Audit Records and their Content
section.p: The records created by the Couchbase Auditing facililty capture information on who has done what, when, and how.

ul.li: Who refers to administrators performing actions. To access the system, each administrator has authenticated, either locally or by means of LDAP: and is therefore identifiable throughout their session.
What refers to the administrative action being performed. 30 different kinds of action are tracked by Couchbase Server.
When refers to the UTC time stamp that corresponds to each recorded action.
How refers to the success or failure status resulting from the recorded action.

section.p: Audit records are created by Couchbase Server-processes, which run asynchronously. Each record is stored as a JSON file, which can be retrieved and inspected.

section.title: Configuring the Couchbase Auditing Facility
section.p: Only a full administrator can configure auditing. Configuration is performed by means of the Couchbase Web Console.
To configure auditing select: Security Audit :

dlentry.dd: Use the check box to enable or disable auditing.
Specify the target directory path for storing the audit records.
This is a log rotation time interval (in Days, Hours, or Minutes), after which the log gets rotated to the next file.

section.title: Configuring with CLI
section.p: The following CLI syntax is used to configure Couchbase auditing for administrators:
section.codeblock: couchbase-cli setting-audit OPTIONS --audit-log-rotate-interval=[MINUTES] //log rotation interval --audit-log-path=[PATH] //target log directory --audit-enabled=[0|1] //enable auditing or not
